item.title: Steam On Linux Use Recedes Slightly During August
item.description: For the Steam Survey results published last month for July it showed Steam on Linux use approaching 3%. With hitting 2.89% in July there was hope that perhaps in August it would breach the elusive 3.0% threshold not seen since the original days of Steam on Linux when the overall Steam user base was also much smaller than it is today. But that didn't pan out and Steam on Linux numbers for August are showing a small dip...

item.title: GIMP 3.1.4 Released With A Project From 2006 Resurrected And Another Big Feature
item.description: GIMP 3.1.4 is out today as the second development release treking toward GIMP 3.2. Most notable with GIMP 3.1.4 are the initial implementations of two of the main features planned for GIMP 3.2: link layers and vector layers...

item.title: El Salvador Fortifies Bitcoin Treasury Amid Quantum Threat Fears — Is This a Warning?
item.description:
El Salvador’s National Bitcoin Office moved its roughly 6,284 BTC (about $682M) from one public wallet into 14 unused addresses capped at 500 BTC each to harden custody and limit exposure to potential quantum-era key-recovery risks.

item.title: Malicious npm Package nodejs-smtp Mimics Nodemailer, Targets Atomic and Exodus Wallets
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a malicious npm package that comes with stealthy features to inject malicious code into desktop apps for cryptocurrency wallets like Atomic and Exodus on Windows systems.
The package, named nodejs-smtp, impersonates the legitimate email library nodemailer with an identical tagline, page styling, and README descriptions, attracting a total of 347

item.title: Trump’s Crypto Project WLFI Under Attack as Ethereum Upgrade Backfires – What Went Wrong?
item.description:
Hackers are systematically exploiting Ethereum's EIP-7702 upgrade to steal World Liberty Financial tokens from Donald Trump's crypto project, according to SlowMist security researchers, with attacks leveraging a vulnerability in the May Pectra upgrade that allows externally owned accounts to delegate control to smart contracts.

The post Trump’s Crypto Project WLFI Under Attack as Ethereum Upgrade Backfires – What Went Wrong? appeared first on Cryptonews.
